Eisha meets the renowned food blogger and caterer, Mehnaz Mansud, who introduces her to some of the forgotten recipes of Parsi cuisine such as Dodima Gosht, the unusual and yet sublime fusion of mutton and bottle gourd.

programme.title: Bliss
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Bliss, Sunny Beach Bulgaria
programme.desc: Along with basking in the idyllic beach scenes of Bulgaria, Kirsty admires the art in Helena resort, and experiences the local traditions and cuisine.

programme.title: Best From The Rest
programme.sub-title: S01 : E31 Best From The Rest Oman Must Sees
programme.desc: Here is a list of Oman’s must-see attractions, each of which unveils a unique facet of this Middle Eastern gem.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 World Spas Gaya Island Resort, Malaysia
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries a massage inspired by the waves of the sea and a chocolate vanilla body wrap at the Gaya Island Resort in Malaysia.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E19 Great World Hotels Dieswaene (ENG)
programme.desc: Elisha gets some old-world style pampering at Die Swaene, a luxury boutique hotel situated in the heart of the historic center of Bruges.

programme.title: The Food Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Food Guide Salzburg, Austria
programme.desc: Salzburg, boasts a culinary scene as sensational as Mozart, the composer who was born here. Chef Joe Remblance enjoys some of its celebrated dishes.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Sabrina Chakici visits Manchester, the city of football and fashion, the city of heritage and hedonism, the city of the industrial revolution.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Viajar Mexico El Tule
programme.desc: Charlie shows the best ways to navigate the vibrant culinary scene of Mexico’s gastronomic capital, Oaxaca.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore
programme.desc: On a trip to Amman, one of the world’s oldest cities, Shaunak finds himself taken back to a different stage of the city’s history at every turn.

programme.title: Quest
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Quest Fort Begu 2, India
programme.desc: While the vast majority of Rajasthan’s inhabitants have always been staunch vegetarians, there has been tremendous popularity of the meat dishes in the state’s culinary culture. This came mainly from the Rajput rulers, which is why Alex meets Ajayraj Singh who comes from a royal lineage. He introduces her to the history of the valiant rulers of Mewar and some of the secret meat preparations of the kingdom

programme.title: Timeless Tamil Nadu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Timeless Tamil Nadu Thanjavur, India
programme.desc: Alex takes a trip to Thanjavur, curious about why it has always been called “the cradle of arts”. Soon, she is lost in the magnificence of the Great Living Chola Temples, with their stunning architecture and intricate carvings, rich in symbolism. At a center for making bronze statues, she is surprised to find out how ancient is the art form. The highlight of her trip, however, is a visit to a workshop for making musical instruments, where she is treated to an impromptu performance.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Bucket List Hitoyoshi, Japan
programme.desc: A classic steam locomotive leading you to a relaxing hot spring bath in the mountainside - sounds like a story, doesn’t it? Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty make this story come true with an onsen or a traditional Japanese hot spring bath in Hitoyoshi, an idyllic town surrounded by mountains and blessed with the Kumagawa river.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Viajar Mexico Villa Del Carbon
programme.desc: From greenery and culture to spiritual power, Charlie reveals the things that make some of Mexico’s towns ‘Pueblo Magicos’.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle, where a mysterious stone tells tales of Scottish monarchs. But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Xplore
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Xplore Jordan Jerash, Jordan
programme.desc: Shaunak visits the Roman ruins strewn across an ancient city that was buried in sand for hundreds of years.

programme.title: Quest
programme.sub-title: S01 : E22 Quest Heritage Haveli, India
programme.desc: Where many ancient Indian civilizations flourished in the most resource-filled areas, the people of Rajasthan created a powerful, complex, layered and regal culture and cuisine in the largely arid land that they called home. Alex discovers this when she meets Anjali Singh, a member of the royal family of Jaipur, who shows her how to make two prized recipes from her family’s legacy - Papad Ki Chutney and Safed Murg.

programme.title: Timeless Tamil Nadu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Timeless Tamil Nadu Nilgiris, India
programme.desc: Ooty has been known to charm visitors ever since British officers used to go there to escape the infamous Indian summer. Sipping tea at the tiered tea plantations, strolling by serene lakes and gushing waterfalls, gawking at gentle deer and majestic elephants at Mudumalai National Park, Alex loses herself in the breathtaking natural beauty of this retreat nestled in the Nilgiri hills.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Bucket List Takachiho, Japan
programme.desc: Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty try bungee jumping at the staggeringly high Kobae Bridge. Following this, they explore some rejuvenating nature trails at Takachiho, stumble upon a shrine in a park, and learn the story behind it in a riveting manner, later that day.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Viajar Mexico Ciudad De Mexico
programme.desc: Enter Charlie Rubio: a bona fide Mexican, who is here to reveal all the wonderful things that make Mexico his favorite place in the world.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Xplore
programme.desc: Shaunak navigates the lost city of Petra that was once the capital of the powerful Nabatean empire.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Bihar’s rural heartland has a lot to offer the intrepid traveller. Alex meets Rajesh Ramjan, a politician, a cultural conservationist and a foodie, who shows her the beauty of Bihar’s countryside and introduces her to some traditional Bihari dishes. From dahi-chura, the Bihari breakfast of champions to flavourful preparations of fresh local vegetables simmering on a traditional stove, Alex gets an understanding of the nourishing cuisine that fuels farmers to toil in the fields all day.

programme.title: Timeless Tamil Nadu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Timeless Tamil Nadu Kodaikanal, India
programme.desc: Kodaikanal - the name means “The Gift of the Forest”. True to its name, the cozy hill station nestled in Tamil Nadu’s Palani Hills is captivating with its verdant hills, cascading waterfalls, and postcard-perfect lakes. Alex is truly astonished, however, when she stumbles onto an observatory here that has been tracking solar activity for around 115 years!

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Bucket List Aso, Japan
programme.desc: The caldera, Mount Aso, is home to Japan’s most active volcano. It is also the perfect destination for those seeking an adrenaline rush and some breathtaking views. Amidst the various moods of the caldera, Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty explore the unique experiences this caldera has to offer.

programme.title: City breaks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 City breaks Samarkand, Uzbekistan
programme.desc: Stories of king Timur’s reign and the Silk road lie in the mosaic-covered masterpieces of ancient Samarkand.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Xplore
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Xplore Jordan Wadi Rum
programme.desc: Shaunak is enchanted by the surreal landscape of Wadi Rum in Jordan, but the highlight of his trip is finding an ancient map hidden in a cave.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Considered among the oldest communities in India, the Gaud Saraswat Brahmans have a culture and cuisine that is still largely unexplored. Eisha sets out to explore the lesser-known flavours of this cuisine with the renowned chef, Sudip Pai, who introduces her to some of the culinary gems of his community. While she cooks with him, she also comes to know about the beliefs and traditions that govern the cuisine and way of life of the community.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: With just 48 hours on hand, London-based adventurer, Natalie Gayle has set out to explore the true character of the Lion City: Singapore.

programme.title: Timeless Tamil Nadu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Timeless Tamil Nadu Rameshwaram, India
programme.desc: In the last leg of her journey in Tamil Nadu, Alex visits one of India’s southernmost towns, Rameshwaram. Here, she is treated to stunning views of azure waters and coral islands that stretch all the way to Sri Lanka. What she doesn't expect to find, however, are the ruins of a ghost town sitting on a beach.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 10 Days Scotland Isle Of Skye (ENG)

programme.desc: Frieshia feels the magic of Mauritius through the unique blend of modernity and tradition offered at the luxury resort.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E34 XP Guide Bangkok, Thailand
programme.desc: Derived from Thai words, "Bang" meaning Village and "Kok" meaning Olive, the city transformed from fishing village to a cosmopolitan as we know today.

programme.title: The Food Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E26 The Food Guide Budapest, Hungary
programme.desc: Traditional Hungarian fare is a hearty affair, not meant for the faint-hearted. The cuisine has imbibed influences from the days of its Ottoman occupation as well as from the other nations of the Austro-Hungarian Empire and traditional Jewish cuisine. Celebrity chef and traveller, Joe Remblance explores the nuances of this cuisine in Budapest, the capital city, through local dishes such as Schnitzel, Gundel Palacsinta, Hungarian Lángos and Tokaji, a sweet Hungarian wine.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E27 Backpack Novi Sad, Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Novi Sad, the financial and industrial hub of Serbia.Starting with canoeing on Danube and later exploring the city and its landmarks.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Boarding Pass Santa Village, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Xplore Bulgaria Sunny Beach
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Food Fact Fun The Hague, Netherlands
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Boarding Pass Rovaniemi, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 1(Eng)
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Food Fact Fun Rotterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Boarding Pass Levi, Finland
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 2(Eng)
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E14 Food Fact Fun Utrecht, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Boarding Pass Ruka Kuusamo, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 World Heritage Ancient Temples of Egypt, Egypt (ENG)
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 Food Fact Fun Gouda, Netherlands
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 10 Days Scotland Isle Of Skye (ENG)
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E31 Backpack Resavsk Pecina, Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 With Love From Mauritius Ep 1
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 World Spas Kempenki, Jordan (ENG)
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Food Fact Fun Dubai 1
programme.desc: After Burj Khalifa, Alex has a traditional Emirati platter, visits the gold market and skiing rink, and goes for a camel safari and camping.

programme.title: City break
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 City Breaks Innsbruck, Austria
programme.desc: Nestled in the mighty Alps, tour the Austrian city of Innsbruck with Sabrina and explore a town that’s alpine-urban yet traditional in nature.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Food Fact Fun Amsterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: In Amsterdam, Alex tries Bitterballen, cannabis cake and visits Heineken Experience brewery. He explores Zaanse Schans village with windmills and Coster Diamonds, the oldest diamond polishing factory.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: Round 3: Manfeild Circuit Chris Amon - Race 2
programme.desc: Watch the second race of the third round of the 2025 Castrol Toyota Formula Regional Championship season at Manfeild Circuit Chris Amon, New Zealand.

programme.title: IndyCar vs Formula 1 car: Technical Comparison
programme.desc: Which is faster: Lewis Hamilton's Formula 1 car, or Scott Dixon's Indycar? Both have had major success in their respective championships, but how different are the two machines? Using our latest 3D animations, Jake Boxall-Legge breaks down everything there is to compare Indycar and Formule 1 cars, from aerodynamics, power, tyres, fuel and more.

programme.title: How Formula 1 Setups Change For Downforce Vs Power Tracks
programme.desc: What makes a Formula 1 downforce track different to a power track? We've all heard the terms before, but different tracks require vastly different car setups to get the maximum advantage around a lap. But what are these requirements? Jake Boxall-Legge dives into why Imola, Monaco, Silverstone and Monza all require different changes to a car to succeed across the board.

programme.title: The banned Lotus that wasn't actually very good
programme.desc: The twin-chassis Lotus 88 is considered the last truly ground-breaking design attempted by Colin Chapman, but we never found out how fast it could have been because it was never allowed to race. However, as Giorgio Piola reveals, while rivals feared the concept, its drivers were not convinced the 88 would have delivered on the track. How did it work? Jake Boxall-Legge guides you through Chapman's complex idea to make ground effect cars more user-friendly.

programme.title: Everything You Need to Know About TYRES in Motorsport
programme.desc: Tyres play a vital role in getting the driver from A to B in a race. Here's the rundown of the variety of tyres and how they are used across different motorsports. programme.title: British GT 2025 | Round 9: Donington Park II
programme.desc: Watch the ninth round of the 2025 British GT Championship at Donington Park.

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Prologue
programme.desc: The BP Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal kicked off in Grândola with a 5 km prologue, marking the start of its second edition. Daniel Sanders (Red Bull KTM) claimed his 20th special win in RallyGP, while Edgar Canet (Rally2), Thomas Zoldos (Rally3), and Antanas Kanopkinas (quads) also took victories. FIA leader Nasser Al Attiyah (Dacia) repeated his 2024 prologue win ahead of Toyota’s Lucas Moraes and João Ferreira, while Carlos Sainz (Ford) finished last in class. Portuguese fans celebrated local triumphs from Gonçalo Guerreiro (Challenger) and Alexandre Pinto (SSV). Stage 1, a 425 km loop around Grândola, begins on Wednesday at 8:05 am (UTC+1).

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 1
programme.desc: Stage 1 of the bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal saw fierce battles on a 425 km loop around Grândola. Red Bull KTM’s Daniel Sanders (RallyGP) and Edgar Canet (Rally2) doubled up on their prologue wins, while Thomas Zoldos repeated in Rally3 and Gaëtan Martinez took the quad lead. In cars, Henk Lategan (Toyota) claimed the stage and overall lead ahead of four fellow Toyotas, as Nasser Al Attiyah (Dacia) slipped to eighth after a penalty. Mattias Ekström (Challenger) and Alexandre Pinto (SSV) also triumphed. Stage 2 heads into Spain with the week’s longest test: 655 km, including 429 against the clock.

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 2
programme.desc: The bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal’s longest stage, a 655 km route from Grândola to Badajoz, delivered high drama on Thursday. Red Bull KTM’s Daniel Sanders edged Tosha Schareina in RallyGP, while teammate Edgar Canet extended his Rally2 lead. France’s Thomas Zoldos (Rally3) and Gaëtan Martinez (quads) dominated their classes, and João Ferreira (Toyota) claimed a breakthrough Ultimate win over mentor Carlos Sainz. Dacia endured setbacks as Nasser Al-Attiyah and Sébastien Loeb lost significant time. Portugal celebrated a historic triple in FIA categories with Ferreira, Gonçalo Guerreiro (Challenger), and Alexandre Pinto (SSV). Stage 3 will cover 511 km around Badajoz on Friday.

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 3
programme.desc: Yesterday in Badajoz, Daniel Sanders deprived Tosha Schareina of a coveted home win by just 4 seconds, but the Spaniard got his own back today, edging out the Australian at the end of a lengthy duel. "Chucky" fought gallantly despite having to open the course but had to yield near the finish. Schareina secured his first win since stage 5 of the Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge by 3′18″ and rocketed into the overall lead. The two favourites are now 1′42″ apart in the race for the trophy. "Chucky", who had remained undefeated since the start of the bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal, was reminded that all good things must come to an end. Tomorrow, he will set out to take back control from the new...

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 4
programme.desc: Tosha Schareina, the only man who had managed to beat Daniel Sanders this week, started the special with an overall lead of 1′42″. The Spaniard was leading the charge following his stage win yesterday, so he played it safe and managed to limit the damage to a 50-second deficit to the Australian 248 km into the 274 course. All that changed when he took the wrong turn a few minutes later, a blunder that came with a hefty price tag of 4′54″ lost to Sanders, who moved back into the hot seat. 3′12″ now separate "Chucky" and Schareina going into the finale, where the Spaniard faces an almost unsurmountable task. The man from Oz could be hours away from securing the RallyGP world championship....

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 5
programme.desc: Daniel Sanders will forever be remembered as the first rider to claim the RallyGP title before the last event of the series. The Australian, who had been going from strength to strength in the three previous rounds, took it up to the fourth dimension in Lisbon. He crossed the finish line with 3′40″ to spare over runner-up Tosha Schareina (Monster Energy Honda HRC), who proved unable to defend his title. "Chucky", who nabbed four specials out of six, is the fourth rider to sit on the FIM throne in rally raids, following Sam Sunderland (2022), Luciano Benavides (2023) and Ross Branch (2024). His stats are out of this world, including records for the most RallyGP specials won in a single...

programme.desc: The bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal’s longest stage, a 655 km route from Grândola to Badajoz, delivered high drama on Thursday. Red Bull KTM’s Daniel Sanders edged Tosha Schareina in RallyGP, while teammate Edgar Canet extended his Rally2 lead. France’s Thomas Zoldos (Rally3) and Gaëtan Martinez (quads) dominated their classes, and João Ferreira (Toyota) claimed a breakthrough Ultimate win over mentor Carlos Sainz. Dacia endured setbacks as Nasser Al-Attiyah and Sébastien Loeb lost significant time. Portugal celebrated a historic triple in FIA categories with Ferreira, Gonçalo Guerreiro (Challenger), and Alexandre Pinto (SSV). Stage 3 will cover 511 km around Badajoz on Friday.

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 3
programme.desc: Yesterday in Badajoz, Daniel Sanders deprived Tosha Schareina of a coveted home win by just 4 seconds, but the Spaniard got his own back today, edging out the Australian at the end of a lengthy duel. "Chucky" fought gallantly despite having to open the course but had to yield near the finish. Schareina secured his first win since stage 5 of the Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge by 3′18″ and rocketed into the overall lead. The two favourites are now 1′42″ apart in the race for the trophy. "Chucky", who had remained undefeated since the start of the bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal, was reminded that all good things must come to an end. Tomorrow, he will set out to take back control from the new...

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 4
programme.desc: Tosha Schareina, the only man who had managed to beat Daniel Sanders this week, started the special with an overall lead of 1′42″. The Spaniard was leading the charge following his stage win yesterday, so he played it safe and managed to limit the damage to a 50-second deficit to the Australian 248 km into the 274 course. All that changed when he took the wrong turn a few minutes later, a blunder that came with a hefty price tag of 4′54″ lost to Sanders, who moved back into the hot seat. 3′12″ now separate "Chucky" and Schareina going into the finale, where the Spaniard faces an almost unsurmountable task. The man from Oz could be hours away from securing the RallyGP world championship....

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 5
programme.desc: Daniel Sanders will forever be remembered as the first rider to claim the RallyGP title before the last event of the series. The Australian, who had been going from strength to strength in the three previous rounds, took it up to the fourth dimension in Lisbon. He crossed the finish line with 3′40″ to spare over runner-up Tosha Schareina (Monster Energy Honda HRC), who proved unable to defend his title. "Chucky", who nabbed four specials out of six, is the fourth rider to sit on the FIM throne in rally raids, following Sam Sunderland (2022), Luciano Benavides (2023) and Ross Branch (2024). His stats are out of this world, including records for the most RallyGP specials won in a single...

programme.title: Round 3: Manfeild Circuit Chris Amon - Race 2
programme.desc: Watch the second race of the third round of the 2025 Castrol Toyota Formula Regional Championship season at Manfeild Circuit Chris Amon, New Zealand.

programme.title: IndyCar vs Formula 1 car: Technical Comparison
programme.desc: Which is faster: Lewis Hamilton's Formula 1 car, or Scott Dixon's Indycar? Both have had major success in their respective championships, but how different are the two machines? Using our latest 3D animations, Jake Boxall-Legge breaks down everything there is to compare Indycar and Formule 1 cars, from aerodynamics, power, tyres, fuel and more.

programme.title: How Formula 1 Setups Change For Downforce Vs Power Tracks
programme.desc: What makes a Formula 1 downforce track different to a power track? We've all heard the terms before, but different tracks require vastly different car setups to get the maximum advantage around a lap. But what are these requirements? Jake Boxall-Legge dives into why Imola, Monaco, Silverstone and Monza all require different changes to a car to succeed across the board.

programme.title: The banned Lotus that wasn't actually very good
programme.desc: The twin-chassis Lotus 88 is considered the last truly ground-breaking design attempted by Colin Chapman, but we never found out how fast it could have been because it was never allowed to race. However, as Giorgio Piola reveals, while rivals feared the concept, its drivers were not convinced the 88 would have delivered on the track. How did it work? Jake Boxall-Legge guides you through Chapman's complex idea to make ground effect cars more user-friendly.

programme.title: Everything You Need to Know About TYRES in Motorsport
programme.desc: Tyres play a vital role in getting the driver from A to B in a race. Here's the rundown of the variety of tyres and how they are used across different motorsports. Please BeGambleAware and Play Responsibly.

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Prologue
programme.desc: The BP Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal kicked off in Grândola with a 5 km prologue, marking the start of its second edition. Daniel Sanders (Red Bull KTM) claimed his 20th special win in RallyGP, while Edgar Canet (Rally2), Thomas Zoldos (Rally3), and Antanas Kanopkinas (quads) also took victories. FIA leader Nasser Al Attiyah (Dacia) repeated his 2024 prologue win ahead of Toyota’s Lucas Moraes and João Ferreira, while Carlos Sainz (Ford) finished last in class. Portuguese fans celebrated local triumphs from Gonçalo Guerreiro (Challenger) and Alexandre Pinto (SSV). Stage 1, a 425 km loop around Grândola, begins on Wednesday at 8:05 am (UTC+1).

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 1
programme.desc: Stage 1 of the bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal saw fierce battles on a 425 km loop around Grândola. Red Bull KTM’s Daniel Sanders (RallyGP) and Edgar Canet (Rally2) doubled up on their prologue wins, while Thomas Zoldos repeated in Rally3 and Gaëtan Martinez took the quad lead. In cars, Henk Lategan (Toyota) claimed the stage and overall lead ahead of four fellow Toyotas, as Nasser Al Attiyah (Dacia) slipped to eighth after a penalty. Mattias Ekström (Challenger) and Alexandre Pinto (SSV) also triumphed. Stage 2 heads into Spain with the week’s longest test: 655 km, including 429 against the clock.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2022 - stop #5 - Xtreme Verbier (SUI)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Freeride World Tour 2022 "Live Summary"
programme.desc: The final showdown of the Freeride World Tour 2022 is right around the corner and it’ll take place in Verbier, Switzerland between 26th of March and 3rd of April.

programme.title: Mbuzi Dume - Strong Goat - Kilimandscharo (TZN)
programme.desc: Tom Belz was faced with the challenge of his life: The 31-year-old goes through life with one leg and two crutches and then climbs the highest mountain in Africa. He also wants to encourage others with his own story.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup & GWA Wingfoil World Cup - Dakhla (MAR)
programme.desc: The GKA Kite-Surf World Cup and the GWA Wingfoil World Cup in Dakhla, Morocco, bring together the best kite surfers and wingfoilers in the world. The riders show off their technical skills and innovation in the wave riding disciplines.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024 - Ibiraquera (BRA)
programme.desc: Ibiraquera in Brazil is the venue for the GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024, which brings together the best kitesurfers in the world. Athletes from all over the world will compete for the title and show impressive skills in wave riding and strapless freestyle.

programme.title: Copa Kitley GKA Big Air Kite World Cup 2024 - Jericoacoara (BRA)
programme.desc: Jericoacoara/Brazil welcomes the Copa Kitley GKA Big Air Kite World Cup 2024, where the world's best kiteboarders test the limits of big air. This hotspot provides a stage for breathtaking jumps, technical tricks and intense competitions.

programme.title: Copa Kitley GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup 2024 - Cauipe (BRA)
programme.desc: The Cauipe lagoon is the venue for the Copa Kitley GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup 2024, which brings together the best freestyle kiteboarders in the world. The Brazilian paradise offers the perfect playground for explosive tricks.

programme.title: Mystic Sk8 Cup 2025 - Live delayed (Vert/Bowl/Street) Part 1
programme.desc: The Mystic Sk8 Cup 2025 celebrates its 30th anniversary at the legendary Štvanice Island Skatepark. This international skateboarding event welcomes over 180 riders from all over the world to compete in the street, bowl and vert disciplines.

programme.title: Defender GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024 – Sylt (GER) – Overall Highlights
programme.desc: Stopover of the kite surfing discipline on the Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour in Sylt, Germany. The Defender GKA Kite World Cup Sylt is held in two disciplines - Kite-Surf and Hydrofoil Big Air.

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup 2024 – Sal (CPV) – Rider Profile | Elena Moreno
programme.desc: Cape Verde is hosting the GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024, bringing together the best kitesurfers in the world like Elena Moreno. From breathtaking freestyle tricks to impressive racing moments, her determination and talent are on display.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024 - Sal (CPV)
programme.desc: Cape Verde hosts the GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024, bringing together the world’s best kite-surfers. Athletes from around the globe compete for the title, showcasing impressive skills in wave-riding and strapless freestyle.

programme.title: Sunny
programme.desc: Level 1 injected a positive mood into the ski season – giving a dose of light therapy to dark northern landscapes of Scandinavia, Alaska, Japan and British Columbia. So sit back and relax, put your shades on and soak up the rays- the future looks bright.

programme.title: Trans Napoli - A Mountain Bike Expedition Naples (ITA)
programme.desc: TransNapoli is an urban MTB adventure led by legendary mountain bike pioneer Hans Rey. It is a colorful five-day tour that crosses the Amalfi and Naples regions of Italy on mountain bikes and e-bikes.

programme.title: FIL Natural Track Luge World Cup 2018/19 - Moscow (RUS)
programme.desc: In contrast to artificial toboggan runs, natural toboggan runs consist of mountain roads and trails. Natural track tobogganing requires a completely different technique than on an artificial track. At the finish, hundredths of a second decide whether you win or lose.

programme.title: Snow Bike Festival 2019 - Gstaad (SUI)
programme.desc: The Snow Bike Festival 2019 is THE event of the young snow bike boom and brings together like-minded athletes from all over the world. With the extra wide and grippy wheels you are ready for your exciting ride in the snow.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour - 25 Years Xtreme Verbier - Verbier (SUI)
programme.desc: The Verbier Xtreme gave birth to the Freeride World Tour, the Freeride World Qualifiers and the Freeride Junior Tour and sparked an international wave of competitive freeriding.

programme.title: The legend of Muksu river - Tajikistan
programme.desc: This is a journey to the Silk Road in Central Asia into the adventurous world of canoeing. The Muksu in Tajikistan is one of the three most difficult rapids here. Once immersed in the river, there is no turning back.

programme.title: Trans Hong Kong - A Urban MTB Adventure (HKG)
programme.desc: The urban mountain bike adventure series combines rides in some of the world's largest cities. In this episode we cycle through the Hong Kong region with none other than Hans “no way” Rey, the grandfather of mountain bike freeriding.

programme.title: Mammut Biggest Peak Project 2 - USA
programme.desc: The Swiss mountaineering company Mammut is celebrating its 150th anniversary with the largest summit project in history: 150 summit ascents are being organized worldwide as part of the “150 Peaks Project”.

programme.title: Athlete Profile - Aurelien Routens
programme.desc: Aurelien Routens from France was vice world champion at the Freeride World Tour 2013 and has made a name for himself with his outstanding web series "Carpe Diem". In our 26-minute portrait, the 36-year-old talks about his life as a snowboard professional.

programme.title: Nedbank Gravel Burn 2025 - Western _ Eastern Cape - Nedbank Gravel Burn 2025 - Western _ Eastern Cape
programme.desc: Info not available

programme.title: Nedbank Gravel Burn 2025 - Western _ Eastern Cape - Nedbank Gravel Burn 2025 - Western _ Eastern Cape
programme.desc: Info not available

programme.title: Nedbank Gravel Burn 2025 - Western _ Eastern Cape - Nedbank Gravel Burn 2025 - Western _ Eastern Cape
programme.desc: Info not available

programme.title: Trans Madeira 2025 Summer: Full Highlights
programme.desc: The Trans Madeira combines the best that Madeira Island and Porto Santo have to offer with six days of racing in the most diverse terrain in the world! With the addition of a new island, you can expect 250km of riding and more than 30 special stages

programme.title: adidas Outdoorsportsteam 2015 - Mountainsports: Climbing & Unicycling
programme.desc: Climbing on speed record in Yosemite Valley (USA) / Unicycling on the Damavand (IR) / Climbing at the Bürser Platte (Austria). Various athletes, different outdoor sports and unique stories - this combines the adidas Outdoorsportsteam.

programme.title: Mammut Biggest Peak Project 1
programme.desc: Anniversary base camp / Jungfraujoch (Switzerland)On 3 August 2011, exactly 200 years after the first ascent, the Swiss mountain sports outfitter Mammut will be organizing the biggest summit project in the history of mountaineering on the “Top of Europe”...

programme.title: Mammut Biggest Peak Project 3 - Cerro Kishtwar
programme.desc: Mammut 150 Peaks Project: Cerro KishtwarKashmir, India, holds some of the world’s most spectacular and mystical mountains. Now with special permissions, an European team will attempt to climb the most aesthetic one of all, Cerro Kishtwar.

programme.title: FIA World Championship – Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge - Daily Highlights Stage #03
programme.desc: The FIA World Championship - Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge 2025 is an exciting motorsport event in the breathtaking desert of the United Arab Emirates. A must for all fans of first-class off-road racing.

programme.title: FIA World Championship – Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge - Daily Highlights Stage #04
programme.desc: The FIA World Championship - Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge 2025 is an exciting motorsport event in the breathtaking desert of the United Arab Emirates. A must for all fans of first-class off-road racing.

programme.title: FIA World Championship – Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge - Daily Highlights Stage #05
programme.desc: The FIA World Championship - Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge 2025 is an exciting motorsport event in the breathtaking desert of the United Arab Emirates. A must for all fans of first-class off-road racing.

programme.title: Simple Session 2025 - Skate Finals MEN
programme.desc: Simple Session is back at Unibet Arena in Tallinn, Estonia – celebrating its massive 25-year anniversary! A quarter-century of mind-blowing BMX riding and skateboarding, unforgettable moments, and a global community of athletes pushing the limits.Hoppla!

programme.title: WOF 2025 #05: 10 Years LAAX OPEN Documentary
programme.desc: The Laax Open has been a meeting place for winter sports fans for years. See the best riders, breathtaking performances and unforgettable moments that have shaped the history of freestyle culture.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #06: Queen & King of the Court Finals 2024
programme.desc: The stage is set for the 2024 Queen & King of the Court Crown Series Finals in Qatar! The best beach volleyball players will compete against each other in the Aspire Zone. From December 12-14, the best athletes in the world will battle it out for the title.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #07: Motosurf World Championship Finals
programme.desc: Welcome to World of Freesports and to the Motosurf World Championship Finals from Macao, China, where the world’s top motosurfers battle for glory against a breathtaking backdrop of speed and precision. Who will conquer and claim the ultimate title?

programme.title: WOF 2025 #08: International Marathon Gorges de l’Ardèche
programme.desc: The Marathon International des Gorges de l'Ardèche is an annual canoe and kayak race in France. Participants navigate a 27-kilometre course through the breathtaking Ardèche Gorge.

programme.title: Episode 46
programme.desc: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2025 - Episode 46

programme.title: V8 Superboats Championship Round 4 + 5
programme.desc: In today´s episode we go Down Under to the extrem water athletes in Australia. We´re oing to find out, who will win the Round 4 and 5 of the V8 Superboats Championship 2021.

programme.title: Emocean - Surf Documentary - Part 2
programme.desc: Today we will listen to some intimate stories of extraordinary people literally living IN and WITH the ocean. We´ll visit some of the most terrifying and beautiful waves around the globe.

programme.title: WES - World E-Bike Series, UCI E-Mountainbike World Cup Cross Country, Race 7 & 8 - Monaco
programme.desc: Hello and welcome to WES World E-Bike Series Round 7 and 8. For the first time since 2019, the Monaco - Alpes-Maritimes Round will welcome the Season Finale, this time with a brand new track in the French area of Turini, and the much awaited awards ceremony.

programme.title: 2025 Open Faces Obertauern Challenger - FWQ FINALS - Live delayed Part 1
programme.desc: The Freeride World Tour Challenger in Obertauren provides the big stage for the final decisions on qualification for the Freeride World Tour 2026. The elite of the Challenger riders meet for the final decision at the very last contest

programme.title: BACK TO NORMAL
programme.desc: For Ian Mitchard jumping out of airplanes and soaring above the earth with a nylon canopy is as normal as walking through the grocery store. But when a dramatic accident put the lifestyle he loves in jeopardy, Ian is forced to grapple with his body.

programme.title: Outdoorsportsteam Paragliding - The Dream of Flight
programme.desc: We take you into the sky and accompany a paragliding virtuoso to the Mont Blanc massif, the Atacama Desert in Chile and the Greek island of Santorini. Follow French paraglider pilot Jean-Baptiste Chandelier.

programme.title: Dani Arnold - Ice Climbing at Lake Baikal
programme.desc: Swiss extreme sportsman Dani Arnold went on a challenging expedition to the deepest lake on earth - Lake Baikal. The Siberian winter provided accordingly difficult and fascinating conditions.

programme.title: X-Project 2.0
programme.desc: X-project 2.0 is a worldwide unique project where different winter sports unite in front of the backdrop of a Swiss dreamscape in the mountains of Engadin valley (Canton of Grisons).

programme.title: Emocean - Surf Documentary - Part 2
programme.desc: Today we will listen to some intimate stories of extraordinary people literally living IN and WITH the ocean. We´ll visit some of the most terrifying and beautiful waves around the globe.

programme.desc: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2025 - Episode 46

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2022 - stop #5 - Xtreme Verbier (SUI)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Freeride World Tour 2022 "Live Summary"
programme.desc: The final showdown of the Freeride World Tour 2022 is right around the corner and it’ll take place in Verbier, Switzerland between 26th of March and 3rd of April.

programme.title: Qatar Airways GKA Big Air Kite & GWA Big Air Wingfoil World Championships - Gran Canaria (ESP)
programme.desc: Gran Canaria will host the GKA Big Air Kite World Championships and the GWA Big Air Wingfoil World Championships in July 2024. Athletes from all over the world will compete for the titles and show impressive skills in kiteboarding and wingfoiling.

programme.title: Far Away
programme.desc: Matthias Haunholder and Matthias Mayr present a big mountain freeski film, primarily shot in Austria. Through stunning ski footage and heartfelt interviews, the film explores the intense emotions of parents and loved ones as they cope with the risks faced by the skiers.

programme.title: FIA World Championship – Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge - Prologue Day
programme.desc: The FIA World Championship - Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge 2025 is an exciting motorsport event in the breathtaking desert of the United Arab Emirates. A must for all fans of first-class off-road racing.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2023 - stop #1 - Baqueira Beret (ESP)
programme.desc: The 2023 Freeride World Tour kicks off in January in its 16th season – as usual with the best freeriders all over the globe! The first stop of the tour takes place in Baqueira Beret.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2019 - Hakuba (JPN)
programme.desc: The Freeride World Tour (FWT) has expanded to Asia! The season opener of the world's most important freeride series for skiers and snowboarders takes place in Hakuba (JPN).

programme.title: FIL Natural Track Luge World Cup 2018/19 - Deutschnofen (ITA)
programme.desc: In contrast to artificial toboggan runs, natural toboggan runs consist of mountain roads and trails. Natural track tobogganing requires a completely different technique than on an artificial track. At the finish, hundredths of a second decide whether you win or lose.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2019 - Kicking Horse, Golden BC (CAN)
programme.desc: After an epic start to Winter 2019 in Hakuba, Japan, the world's best make their way across the Pacific to North America for the second competition of FWT19 at the legendary Canadian Rockies resort of Kicking Horse, Golden BC.

programme.title: WOF 2024 #19: Pasko the Magic Move
programme.desc: Recovering from testicular cancer, professional athlete and filmmaker Maarten Molenaar embarks on a journey to Fuerteventura to learn a new freestyle windsurfing trick - the Pasko.

programme.title: WOF 2024 #25: Profile – Jakob Schubert & Highline Wendestein
programme.desc: Today we dive into the world of alpine sports. In the first part of the show, we look at the greatest achievements of the austian climber Jakob Schubert. Afterwards we turn to a high-wire act by highliner Lukas Irmler, who faces a special challenge in his home mountains

programme.title: S'abandonner au Sauvage
programme.desc: S'abandonner au Sauvage is an adventure in total autonomy without any canoeing experience on the waters of an over 500km long canadian river.

programme.title: Keep On Keeping On
programme.desc: Keep On Keeping On - Dreaming of Rampage portraits Johny Salidos career and his long way to compete at the Rampage - the holy grail of freeride mountainbiking.

programme.desc: Be part of the World Downhill Skateboarding Championship 2025 in Axamer Lizum, Austria! At this exciting high-speed event, the best downhill skateboarders from all over the world will race down the picturesque Alpine roads at breathtaking speeds.

programme.title: Trans Madeira 2023 Autumn: Full Highlights
programme.desc: Trans Madeira combines the best things the island has to offer with five days of racing, starting high in the mountains and finishing down at the ocean. Get ready for 220km of riding, 30 special stages, exploring North, South, East and West in one mega week!

programme.title: Trans Madeira 2023 Summer: Full Highlights
programme.desc: Trans Madeira combines the best things the island has to offer with five days of racing, starting high in the mountains and finishing down at the ocean. Get ready for 220km of riding, 30 special stages, exploring North, South, East and West in one mega week!

programme.desc: Trans Madeira combines the best things the island has to offer with five days of racing, starting high in the mountains and finishing down at the ocean. Get ready for 220km of riding, 30 special stages, exploring North, South, East and West in one mega week!

programme.title: LINE OF SIGHT | A Look into Wingsuit BASE Jumping
programme.desc: The golden age of wingsuiting is upon us. Through evolving suit technology the initial inflation time has gone down, which has lead to quicker starts and more exits. Wingsuit athletes Marshal Miller, Jesse Hall, and Sean Chuma take you through the iconic jumps.

programme.title: Mammut Athlete Profile Dani Arnold - The Art of Iceclimbing
programme.desc: Daniel Arnold was born in 1984 in the Swiss canton of Uri and grew up in the small mountain village of Biel in the heart of the Swiss Alps. Dani and his brother experience all aspects of mountain life: hiking, skiing and climbing in some of the toughest climbing locations in the world

programme.title: 2025 Open Faces Obertauern Challenger - FWQ FINALS - Live delayed Part 2
programme.desc: The Freeride World Tour Challenger in Obertauren provides the big stage for the final decisions on qualification for the Freeride World Tour 2026. The elite of the Challenger riders meet for the final decision at the very last contest

programme.desc: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2025 - Episode 46

programme.title: WOF 2025 #09: Asics Saintélyon
programme.desc: The Asics SaintéLyon is a legendary nocturnal ultramarathon in France that takes place on the route from Saint-Étienne to Lyon. The 2025 edition is scheduled for November 29 and 30 and promises to be an unforgettable experience for everyone involved.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #10: World Rookie Tour - 20 Years Anniversary Documentary
programme.desc: Launched in 2005, the World Rookie Tour (WRT) is the largest international youth action sports series dedicated to developing the next generation of professional athletes in the sports of snowboarding, freeskiing, skateboarding and surfing.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #11: Epic Series – Season Preview
programme.desc: Today we take you on an exciting journey. Get ready for an exclusive preview of the Absa Cape Epic and the Epic Series 2025 - the ultimate test of endurance, skill and teamwork.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #12: Mediterranean Epic by Scott 2025
programme.desc: February 6-9, 2025, Oropesa del Mar (ESP): The Mediterranean Epic is a UCI 4-stage race where mountain bikers can enjoy mountain biking to the fullest on the course around Oropesa del Mar in the province of Castellón in Spain.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2023 - stop #1 - Baqueira Beret (ESP)
programme.desc: The 2023 Freeride World Tour kicks off in January in its 16th season – as usual with the best freeriders all over the globe! The first stop of the tour takes place in Baqueira Beret.

programme.title: Qatar Airways GKA Kite Park League World Championships – Hood River (USA) – Best Of
programme.desc: The moment many people have been waiting for is finally here - one of the biggest kiteboarding events. While there are many great kiteboarding locations around the globe, perhaps one of the most historic is Hood River, Oregon, the birthplace of parkriding.

programme.title: WOF 2024 #09: SSL Gold Cup
programme.desc: Final Series 2023 - World Class Sailing - SSL Gold Cup 2023Der SSL Gold Cup ist eine spannende Ausscheidungsserie und wird auf den Kanarischen Inseln ausgetragen. Die 24 besten Nationen der SSL-Rangliste und 16 Nationen aus der Qualifikationsserie nehmen daran teil.

programme.title: FWT Challenger 2025 X Over Ride Kitzsteinhorn Challenger – Zell am See-Kaprun - Live delayed Part 1
programme.desc: The FWT Challenger 2025 X Over Ride Kitzsteinhorn took place from March 15 to 18, 2025 in Zell am See-Kaprun. At this event as part of the Freeride World Tour qualification series, top freeriders competed against each other on the slopes of the Kitzsteinhorn

programme.title: FIL Natural Track Luge World Championships 2019 - Latzfons (ITA)
programme.desc: Im Gegensatz zu künstlichen Rodelbahnen bestehenden Naturbahnen aus Bergstraßen und -wegen. Naturbahnrodeln erfordert eine völlig andere Technik als auf einer Kunstbahn. Im Ziel entscheiden Hundertstelsekunden über Sieg oder Niederlage.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2019 - Fieberbrunn (AUT)
programme.desc: With two events in the pipeline and a fiercely competitive race for the world title quickly unfolding, the best in the world will get their chance to “Hold The Line” in Fieberbrunn as FWT19 enters the European leg of the season.

programme.title: FIL Natural Track Luge World Cup 2018/19 - Umhausen (AUT)
programme.desc: In contrast to artificial toboggan runs, natural toboggan runs consist of mountain roads and trails. Natural track tobogganing requires a completely different technique than on an artificial track. At the finish, hundredths of a second decide whether you win or lose.

programme.title: Beni SpeedTransalp
programme.desc: For this route from Ruhpolding (GER) to Kasern (ITA), 210 kilometers and more than 10000 meters of vert, recreational athletes need approximately five to seven days. Benedikt Boehm is aiming for the magic time limit of 36 hours, non-stop.

programme.title: Underdog
programme.desc: The Ultra-Trail du Mont-Blanc© - Edition 2018171 kilometers - 10,000 meters ascent - 2,300 runnersFor the 2018 UTMB© Damian Hall is ranked 50th by the International Trail Running Association© (ITRA© ).

programme.title: Dream Job
programme.desc: A comedy documentary about a girl working in the ski industry who decides to become one of the stars: they go up, they go down, how difficult can it be? Needless to say, she finds out how hard it really can be.

programme.title: Inside Surfing Ep.1
programme.desc: Inside Surfing tells the stories about the people, places and things that make surfing so special. Is it a sport, an art form or a lifestyle, or all three at the same time? The series provides a look behind the scenes of surfing with all its facets.

programme.desc: Connor Herson pushes the limits of what is possible on the rock. But his latest and greatest challenge? Balancing a life climbing cutting edge ascents with his studies at Stanford.

programme.desc: RB Romaniacs challenges hundreds of dedicated amateur participants to compete alongside the world's best professionals. They gather in Sibiu, Romania. Participants come from over 60 countries and continents around the world.

programme.title: THE RIO CAQUETA
programme.desc: Jules Domine and Tyler Bradt, obsessed and addicted to whitewater adventure, make a plan to journey the long way, from the source of Rio Caqueta 1,000 Kilometers downstream to an unreal big water canyon deep in the Colombian Amazon.

programme.title: A Plea For Refuge
programme.desc: Two adventurous friends, Jeff Shapiro and Cody Tuttle, have a desire to experience one of the last, raw, and truly preserved wilderness areas on the North American continent, attempt to hike and fly paraglider's across the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge in Alaska.

programme.title: BACK TO NORMAL
programme.desc: For Ian Mitchard jumping out of airplanes and soaring above the earth with a nylon canopy is as normal as walking through the grocery store. But when a dramatic accident put the lifestyle he loves in jeopardy, Ian is forced to grapple with his body.

programme.title: X-Project 2.0
programme.desc: X-project 2.0 is a worldwide unique project where different winter sports unite in front of the backdrop of a Swiss dreamscape in the mountains of Engadin valley (Canton of Grisons).

programme.title: Mammut Athlete Profile - Ildiko Wermescher
programme.desc: Ultramarathon, also called ultra distance, is any sporting event involving running and walking further than in traditional 42 kilometer marathon. The Mammut athlete Ildiko Wermerscher reflects us her inspiration and motivation for this extreme sport.

programme.title: Mammut Athlete Profile - Ildiko Wermescher
programme.desc: Ultramarathon, also called ultra distance, is any sporting event involving running and walking further than in traditional 42 kilometer marathon. The Mammut athlete Ildiko Wermerscher reflects us her inspiration and motivation for this extreme sport.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #14: Pierra Menta 2025
programme.desc: The Pierra Menta is one of the toughest and most prestigious ski mountaineering races in the world. Held in the French Alps, it challenges teams of two over four days with steep ascents, technical descents, and over 10,000 meters of elevation gain.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #15: Come Hell or High Water - Tibet extreme kayaking adventure
programme.desc: This week we are heading to the tibetian Hymalayans. Under the famous peaks and ridges, down in the deep valleya, lays the playground of some extreme sportsmen.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #16: GKA & GWA Season Start
programme.desc: Today we will have a look at the best Kitsurf and Wingfoil Women od the World, as they kicked off the 2025 season on the capverdian Islands.

programme.desc: The Freeride World Tour 2023 has its second stop in Ordino Arcalís Pro, Andorra - as always with the best freeriders from around the world! Thus, the FWT returns to the freeride Mecca of the Pyrenees.
